characters: WARD SPRINGS TO HIS FEET AND SCREAMS
INTO A FOUNTAIN OF FIRE, VIOLENTLY LAUNCHING WARD BACKWAR
BLASTS UP AND STRIKES THE POWER LINES
BLOWING APART GIBSON INTO A SCREAMING FLAMING SKELETON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCOTT WARD can’t sleep. He scowls in defiance at the gold midday sun scorching through the blinds. Plain but handso with an ‘I’m in charge here’ buzzcut. A thoughtful man, b no genius, he’s stymied by the daylight. We note the ANGR BRUISING on his 200-pushups-a-day chest. Ward tries to fall back asleep. No dice. He shifts his weight and peels his Glock off his sweaty back. Sighs and starts counting the cracks in his bedroom ceiling...

dialogues.speaker: SMASH TO
dialogues.text: EXT. LIQUOR STORE - WARD'S FLASHBACK -—- DAY A GANGBANGER in a black hoodie bursts out the door with a shotgun! WARD stands there in LAPD uniform. Reaches for h holster -- Breaks leather. Steps into a textbook shooting stance. Muzzle coming on target. Too Late... The GANGBANGER spins aims fires -- KABOOM!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ward gasps awake. His fingertips skim the ugly green and purple bruises on his chest. I’m still alive...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ward shuffles into the kitchen -- Sees SHERRI, his age, inspecting dishes in the sink, looking for the easiest on wash. Pretty in a champagne room kind of way. She has an air of entitlement, things should’ve been easier for her. The tension between them is palpable. Ward grabs a huge b of Cheerios, fills a plastic bowl. Without looking up:

dialogues.speaker: SHERRI
dialogues.text: There’s a fairy in the bird feeder again. Ward sighs. Gets the milk from the fridge. Smells it. Expired. Pours it anyway.

dialogues.speaker: SHERRI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s the same fuckin’ one, too. Isn't it? Cause you didn’t kill it last time. Ward steels himself as he tamps cornflakes into sour mil He's been over her shit for a long time -- His tone immediately counters her aggression, mellow, even...

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: I thought you were out looking for a job.

dialogues.speaker: SHERRI
dialogues.text: Oh. Right. Of course. Of course you'd bring that up.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: Yesterday you indicated you would be actively looking for employment. We had a plan, a timeline. And I’m concerned-—

dialogues.speaker: SHERRI
dialogues.text: --Don’t. Don’t do that.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: Do what?

dialogues.speaker: SHERRI
dialogues.text: Your Zen cop ‘I'm talking to a crazy person’ voice you do.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: .--I'm trying to not escalate...

dialogues.speaker: SHERRI
dialogues.text: For your information, I had an interview this morning.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: Okay. That’s good.

dialogues.speaker: SHERRI
dialogues.text: I don’t need you to tell me it’s good. I won’t fuckin’ get it.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: SHERRI
dialogues.text: Because I can tell. Okay? The woman was a snotty bitch.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: Keep at it. Your next interviewer might be a man. You can shake your six thousand dollar bolt-on-tits at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Way to de-escalate asshole. We all know I can make more money than your broke ass ever will dancing. So fuck you. Sophie’s staying at mom’s tonight. You gotta give her a ride. And get the fuckin’ fairy. Kill it this time. Pussy. She grabs her keys and charges out of there. EXT. WARD’S HOUSE - FRONT YARD - DAY Ward peers through the bars of his shitty Craftsman in So Central LA. Gangster THUMP emanates from the house next door. Two Low Riders on the lawn, cabled together. HOMIES solemnly gathered around open hoods. Ward slides the Glock in his pocket. Grabs a broom. Steps out into the sunlight -- His neighbor MIGUEL clocks him.

dialogues.speaker: MIGUEL
dialogues.text: Good afternoon officer. We didn’t wake you up? He salutes. Ward salutes back, on a mission, not slowing down...

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: No, never. Because bass doesn’t carry at all. You know that’s bad for the grass. The cars.

dialogues.speaker: MIGUEL
dialogues.text: Grass grows back. How’s your old lady?

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: Save up your lunch money and ask her yourself. The Homies sense his venom and wince -- Damnnnn.

dialogues.speaker: MIGUEL
dialogues.text: Yo, that fairy in your bird feeder’s been up in my pad eating my dog food. I’m a call the city.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: I am the city. Motherfucker’s about to go to Fairy Heaven. Ward approaches the bird feeder slowly. A dead pigeon la beneath it -- Badly burnt. Ward stops and thinks. He doesn’t need this shit. Raises the broom... The Homies look on, expectant, as they slowly back up... Ward gently pokes the bird feeder. Nothing. THEN: The FAIRY bursts out SCREECHING at him! A sparrow- sized hybrid of lemur and insect. It HISSES like vermin..

dialogues.speaker: MIGUEL
dialogues.text: Aw shit. Ring the bell. It’s on. Ward jabs it with the broom -- It flings a handful of spa at him!

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: Ah! Fuck! The Homies erupt into laughter. Ward ignores them, locked onto his enemy. He fakes left, spins, swats it against th house with a thud -- The Fairy drops to the ground, HISSI helpless, injured...

dialogues.speaker: MIGUEL
dialogues.text: That's it right there. LAPD style. Now watch him finish off the little homie. Ward advancing slowly, clearly pitying the fairy -- It th sparks again -- Ward looks away and brings down the broom with finality -- He's sprayed with purple blood. This gets the expected eruption from the onlookers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ward returns and regards his forgotten bowl of soggy cere His mind tumbles, something washes over his face. He's suddenly somewhere else...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ward is on his back next to the front tire of his black a white. He’s stunned. The buckshot in his vest smoking. Th Gangbanger steps around the corner of the vehicle. Presse the shotgun to Ward’s forehead -- His eyes locked onto th face of holy motherfucking death itself. A face we don’t to_see yet...  CLICK. The shotgun is jammed. The Gangbanger takes off running. ECU WARD -- Gritting his teeth in rage...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shakes his head, wiping his face...

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Daddy! INT. WARD'S HOUSE - SOPHIA’S BEDROOM - DAY Ward's little daughter SOPHIA tries to cram a mound of stuffed animals into her backpack. Ward sits on her bed, eating a banana.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: They don’t fit.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: So just take a couple. You’re only going to Grandma’s for one night.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: If I only take two the rest will miss them.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: You're very considerate. But what about like clothes and toothbrushes and socks and stuff?

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Daddy I’m only going for one night. Ward laughs. Then...

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are you in trouble?

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: Am I in trouble? Did mom say something?

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Mom said you and Nick are in trouble because Nick did something dumb. Ward makes a mental note -- Total information lockdown ti with Sherry. Before he can craft a response...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kayla at school says orcs do dumb stuff because they’re not as smart as people. Did Nick get you in trouble? I don’t want you be in trouble. Ward speaks carefully.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: Orcs aren’t dumb. Okay? All the races are different than us. And being different doesn’t make them smarter or dumber. They’re just like us. Okay? Everyone just wants to get along and be happy.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Can elves really talk to dragons?

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: Not unless they go to the zoo.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Kayla says--

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: --you gotta stop listening to Kayla. Kayla sounds like trouble.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: No, Kayla never gets in trouble.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: Not yet. Being so judgemental won't do Kayla any favors in life. Look. Don’t let anyone tell you what to think. Treat everyone nice and they'll treat you nice. Suddenly a crash outside -- KATHUNK! -- Ward reacts, quic gets up... EXT. WARD’S HOUSE - DAY Ward exits and sees an LAPD Black and White on his lawn.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: Aw come on. What the actual fuck? NICK JAKOBY, early 30s, exits from the driver’s side with grin -- By the way -- JAKOBY'S AN ORC...  Like most ores, he’s bald with green skin, orange eyes and slightly animalistic facial features. He’s friendly and e going, but right now he’s gently on the defensive. From next

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: What? They put new shocks in. I was testing them on your curb.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: On my curb? That makes no sense.

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: Your driveway’s full? door...

dialogues.speaker: MIGUEL
dialogues.text: Hey officer, that’s bad for the grass.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: Yes. Thank you. It grows back. (to Jakoby) Why are you here in our car?

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: I had that diversity training thing up at Elysian. Thought you were going.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: I did it. You can’t run errands in a city car.

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: Your house is on the way to the barn. Hop in. Let’s go to work.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Hi Nick! Sophia exits with a big smile for Jakoby...

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: Hey Sophia, what’s up rockstar?

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: We're packing for grandma’s.

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: That’s cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you shut up, bro? I don’t want you catching days over a stupid mileage beef.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Don’t tell Nick to shut up, he’s a person too!

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: Enlightened kid there, Scott.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jakoby drives. Sophia in back listening to headphones. Wa quietly seethes...

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: This is stupid. I’m in soft clothes with my kid in the car. If we get popped.

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: Right. Because maybe Internal Affairs is running integrity stings on vehicle mileage this week.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: You suck at sarcasm. You’re supposed to use a sarcastic tone when you're being sarcastic.

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: I put what, five extras miles on the car? A buck of gas. That’s a criminal violation. Bro we gotta deny everything. Delete Facebook and lawyer up.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: Exactly like that. A sarcastic tone.

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: Dude. Is it your man-period? Did you sleep?

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: No. Yes. Sort of. I keep seeing that asshole who blasted me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta try melatonin. I gotta bottle in my warbag I'll flip you. Pop one an hour before bed and stay off the laptop. The screen fucks up your circadian rhythm.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: Yeah, okay mom. A beat of silence. What Ward really wants to talk about bubbles agonizingly to the surface.

dialogues.speaker: WARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Nick, did you let that asshole go?

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: Yeah I let him go. Because that’s what I do. Dude’s who shoot my partner get a pass.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: It’s me and you brother. Just me and you talking.

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: It’s fucked up you’d ask me that.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: I saw his face, okay? He was an orc. He was clan-blood.

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: I don’t give a shit about clan- blood. I don’t. You’ve never came at me racial. Not once. You think I'd kick the dude who shot you loose because he’s green? Scott? Ward sighs checks his texts. Then...

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: I know you didn’t. But the guys on our Watch are talking mad shit. So it’s out there. Just know it’s out there. (then) If you came out on front street about it I totally wouldn’t care. Jakoby looks at Ward, with that intense open honesty he h

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: You would. Scott, you would.  10.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ward hugs Sophia goodbye. SHERRI’S MOTHER looks on, while Jakoby waits with the car. Ward SEES Sophia’s crying.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: Hey, Sophia, don’t cry, don’t cry.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: I don’t want you to die.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: Honey. I’m not going to die. I promise. Go with Grandma.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: But mommy said Nick is going to get you killed. Ward can barely contain his anger.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: Mommy's kidding. She says silly things sometime.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: I don’t want you to be dead. I hate you being a policeman. Everybody hates policemen! Sophia twists away. Runs crying towards the house. Ward absorbs the blow for a moment. When he returns to the car Jakoby is gentle with this...

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: Remind me, partner, why Sherri’s not watching her tonight?

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: She’s got a date.

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: Bro. Why are you still letting her live with you?

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: You know why.

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: Sophia’s not your daughter.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: Funny. Cause it sure fucking feels like she is, Nick.  11.

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. You know what I mean. I don’t know how to be on your side when you’re not on your side. Ward angrily gets in the car...

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: Save me, Nick. Save me from all the ex-strippers of the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solidly in the hood. A black SUV pulls up. Two Federal Agents step out in black suits. One is human, he’s all ab Gracie Ju-Jitsu and fine tailoring -- This is MONTEHUGH. The taller Agent is lithe with striking dark skin and dazzling teal eyes. LIKE MOST ELVES his features are near human, if perhaps slightly stretched. Almost too perfect, barring of course, his pointed ears -- This is KANDOMERE.

dialogues.speaker: MONTEHUGH
dialogues.text: It’s, um, rustic here. I’m sure the inhabitants of this outpost have priceless knowledge to aid us on our quest. Kandomere cocks an eyebrow at him.

dialogues.speaker: KANDOMERE
dialogues.text: I apologize there are no local shops with artisanal kale smoothies and organic chicken breast in ten pound servings. Stay on task. Montehugh glares at Kandomere as they enter the station.

dialogues.speaker: MONTEHUGH
dialogues.text: My gains, bruh. Never mock my gains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crammed and with lead paint and peeling asbestos. Kandome and Montehugh check in at the front desk. CAMERA FINDS JAKOBY -- In a nearby hallway, watching the Agents from the shadows. Nervous. Kandomere feels Jakoby’s gaze. Looks over. Jakoby is already gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cops suit up to protect and serve. Ward peels the dry cleaning bag off a fresh uniform.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: Hey, any of you seen my partner? HICKS, a middle aged bulldog of a man, laughs thickly.

dialogues.speaker: HICKS
dialogues.text: Big green dude? Orange eyes? Not exactly a Rhodes Scholar? Why yes. I have seen your partner. BROWN, 20s, with fratboy excitability, jumps in...

dialogues.speaker: BROWN
dialogues.text: Hah. You said partner with airquotes.

dialogues.speaker: HICKS
dialogues.text: See, Ward’s partner is a peace officer.

dialogues.speaker: BROWN
dialogues.text: Fucking outstanding. Airquotes again.

dialogues.speaker: HICKS
dialogues.text: (announces loudly) Anyone have a location on our diversity hire? He likes to wander. Ward fumes. POLLARD, late 30s, with the bitter cold demea of a broken street cop, mutters this:

dialogues.speaker: POLLARD
dialogues.text: Cops don’t wander. Pets wander. Ward, you wanna ride with a dog, work K9. They laugh in that stupid, self congratulatory way racist always do. Ward about to explode... POLLARD (CONT’D) If I get smoked, gentlemen. Let the asshole go.

dialogues.speaker: BROWN
dialogues.text: Dude. I so got you. Done.  13.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: And now I say fuck you to you. You. And you.

dialogues.speaker: HICKS
dialogues.text: You know what they say about clan blood. (ominously) Once for the Dark Lord, always for the Dark Lord.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: How can dumb-asses like you who can’t remember your wife's birthday still have beef against a whole race of people for some shit that went down thousands of years ago?

dialogues.speaker: HICKS
dialogues.text: Race of people.

dialogues.speaker: BROWN
dialogues.text: Bam! Airquotes! You are the fucking master. Ward spins to about to break Brown’s neck... BANG-BANG-BANG! SERGEANT CHING, a badass intelligent fema is pounding on a locker...

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT CHING
dialogues.text: Hi guys. If we’re done handing Ward ammo for his inevitable lawsuit against the Department, it’s time to drink in the Captain's wisdom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cops we met sit at tables. Jakoby and Ward noticeably isolated from the “cool kids”. Jakoby whispers to Ward:

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: I saw feds in the building. They had an elf and everything. Think they’re here for me?

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: You'd be suspended already if something was up. Lay off the energy drinks.  14.

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: Right, man, yeah. CAPTAIN PEREZ enters...

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN PEREZ
dialogues.text: I'd like to welcome everyone to the latest episode of “We Are All Fucked” starring the PM Watch. Mock cheers and real laughs from the boys and girls. CAPTAIN PEREZ (CONT’D) Tonight we got the trifecta. Full moon on a Friday night in a Summer heatwave. The streets will be seriously assholed-up and we’re spread thin as Royce’s comb-over. One of the officers, ROYCE, chuckles. CAPTAIN PEREZ (CONT’D) That means clear your calls fast and help your colleagues clear theirs. Get me outta this reporting period without another murder, I‘’1ll buy you all coffee. This gets a positive, serious response. As he rushes off the next thing... CAPTAIN PEREZ (CONT’D) Sergeant Ching, all yours.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT CHING
dialogues.text: Yessir! A former Marine, she snaps to with her clipboard... SERGEANT CHING (CONT’D) After I call your name, get your shotguns and radios and deploy. I don’t want to see you here unless there’s badguys under the desks. Pollard. Brown. You’re working Three-A-Four.

dialogues.speaker: POLLARD
dialogues.text: Shotguns and radios? When do we get the graham crackers and apple juice?  15.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT CHING
dialogues.text: I will fuck you up, Pollard. I give zero fucks how much time in grade you got. Zero fucks. Ward, Jakoby. Three-A-Nine. Gomez and the rookie with the unpronounceable Thai surname. Three-A-Six. Jakoby and Ward can’t get out of there fast enough...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ward grinds his teeth as Jakoby drives. Jakoby cranks his bluetooth speakers to fill the silence.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: Bro. No. We’re not listening to Orkish folk music.

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: You gonna act like a little bitch all watch? I thought Orcs were supposed to be dark motherfuckers. You need to get laid. Get a Sancha like every other cop working South Central. You got all the hoodrats chasing you.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: I don’t need to get laid.

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: Yes you do. Humans are easy to read. Like you guys have all these little tells.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: Little tells like what?

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: Like when you make this face... Jakoby makes a bizarre face. Ward can’t help it, starts chuckling.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: What face is that? That’s not a face.

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: It’s the face you’re making right now. It’s a human who needs some pussy face.  16.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: Sure. I see it now. Show me another human face. Jakoby makes a bizarre pouting expression.

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: This is when a human finds out he isn’t getting any pancakes.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: (laughing now) It’s true, we do love pancakes. Ward changes the music -- A BANGING TRACK starts. The boy laugh, rolling through the hood. Its modest homes and pal trees splashed with golden late afternoon sunlight...

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: WE SEE brief, beautiful images of the view from their car

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUCH IS FAMILIAR -- KIDS playing football in the street. HOMELESS PEOPLE in tent cities. HISPANIC FAMILIES buying from push carts. HOOKERS selling their souls. SOME LESS SO -- A tough looking group of ORCS glares AT CAMERA from the porch. An OGRE loads an Engine Block into pick-up. A LIZARD MAN sorts bottles and cans. A dwarf wom hurries along with her groceries, walking a small dog. South Central’s as South Central always was, and is as So Central’s never been...

dialogues.speaker: DISPATCH, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Three-Adam-Nine. Four fifteen man. Alameda and Jefferson. Code two. Incident two eight zero six two.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: Three-Adam-Nine. Roger, show us enroute. Jakoby busts a U as Ward checks the computer for deets on call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bearded HOMELESS MAN, shirtless, dirty and emaciated, wildly swings a broadsword in the middle of the intersect Screaming his head off...  17.

dialogues.speaker: HOMELESS MAN
dialogues.text: A great cloud is coming, a great black cloud of fire! The Dark Lord grows closer every day! We may have forgotten about magic, but magic has not forgotten about us! Jakoby and Ward's cruiser glides to a stop alongside an L Sheriff's car. Alone behind the wheel is RODRIGUEZ. A goo dude and a good cop, he gives Jakoby and Ward a “wassup” tilt. The three nonplussed cops watch the show... HOMELESS MAN (CONT’D) The Dark Lord’s eyes are opening! They are opening!

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: Suspect’s nine feet tall, burning red eyes, black armor, flaming ax, got it.

dialogues.speaker: RODRIGUEZ
dialogues.text: It’s the full moon, dude.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: Yep. What’s your plan Rodriguez?

dialogues.speaker: RODRIGUEZ
dialogues.text: My plan? Nothing. He’s on your side of the street. But he crosses that yellow line, I’m dumping him with the crowd pleaser. Rodriguez grabs his shotgun. Jakoby sighs. Grabs the microphone. Flips the console to PA mode...

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: (booming over the PA) Sir. Sir. Drop the sword. Drop. The. Sword.

dialogues.speaker: HOMELESS MAN
dialogues.text: You! The homeless man points his sword directly at Jakoby...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOMELESS MAN (CONT’D) Two thousand years ago we fought him with swords and arrows! Now he rises again. We will fight him with bullets and bombs!

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: Why’re Orcs always the bad guys?  18.

dialogues.speaker: RODRIGUEZ
dialogues.text: Don't look at me, man. Mexicans still get shit for the Alamo. Ward's had enough -- Pops out with his Glock...

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: Yo. Unless you wanna die, drop the sword. Right. Fucking. Now. Wow. Ward can be a real asshole. The Man tosses the sword Drops to his knees. Shows his hands -- He knows the drill

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: I got him, partner. Jakoby snaps on his gloves. Approaches. Cuffs the Man. Walking him back to the cars. Rodriguez about to bail...

dialogues.speaker: RODRIGUEZ
dialogues.text: Real quick, eh. Gang Intel guys are sayin’ Fogteeth activity’s off the chain. And Altamira’s gangbanging like it’s 1999. Watch your backs tonight. He takes off as Jakoby stuffs the Man in back. The second he’s in the car he VOMITS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jakoby and Ward endure the puke smell as the Man rants.

dialogues.speaker: HOMELESS MAN
dialogues.text: The army of 9 races fought shoulder to shoulder to give you the world you take for granted now! Remember the old ways before the darkness returns! The clock ticks! The minute hand moves towards midnight!

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: Can you just chill for a sec? The Man bores into Ward's eyes with his. Low and quiet:

dialogues.speaker: HOMELESS MAN
dialogues.text: The Blood Moon is nigh and your test begins. Remember, the only truth is in your heart. Pass the test and thirty three seconds will be your reward.  19. Ward looks at him entranced. Snaps out of it. Looks at Jakoby -- Who's feeling the creepiness too...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ward hoses the vomit out of the back. Captain Perez and t scary Internal Affairs Detectives -- ARKASHIAN and YAMAHA approach. All duly grim...

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN PEREZ
dialogues.text: Where’s Jakoby?

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: Booking our body, sir. The IA Detectives get in Ward's space. Eye him head to to Pure intimidation. Perez looks around. Leans on the car. He can be pretty scary himself. Quietly:

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN PEREZ
dialogues.text: The Department’s always been cutting edge. First radio cars. Helicopters. SWAT team. First to hire Orcs. We’re committed to diversity. As is Sacramento and Washington. But the politicians haven't worked the ghetto. They’re not boots on the ground like we are.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: Where’s this going, sir?

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN PEREZ
dialogues.text: The Orc who shot you is on the street because of Jakoby.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: Respectfully I disagree. Jakoby did no wrong.

dialogues.speaker: ARKASHIAN
dialogues.text: Do Orcs have mad hops? How many Ores are ballers?

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: YAMAHARA
dialogues.text: You fucking heard the Detective. How many Orcs play pro basketball?  20.

dialogues.speaker: ARKASHIAN
dialogues.text: None. They’re slow. They’re heavy. That’s why half the NFL linebackers are Orcish. It’s simple physics.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: ARKASHIAN
dialogues.text: Fuck you. That’s who we are.

dialogues.speaker: YAMAHARA
dialogues.text: Okay, let’s review kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Resuming the backstory here -- Ward, flat on his back, st into the angry orange eyes of the Orc Gangbanger -- CLICK The Orc tosses the jammed shotgun and runs into a crowded SWAP MEET. Jakoby takes off after him...

dialogues.speaker: YAMAHARA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You respond to a silent ringer and some Orc lays you out with buckshot. Jakoby foot pursues and corners shithead in a dead end alley. Then it gets mysterious. IN THE DEAD END ALLEY -- The Gangbanger charges. Knocks Jakoby down. His Glock SKITTERS across piss-soaked asphalt...

dialogues.speaker: ARKASHIAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Jakoby stated dude tackles him. Disarms him. Jumps up, grabs a fire escape ladder. Evades arrest. ON THE FIRE ESCAPE -- Gangbanger kicks in a window, dives

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arkashian and Yamahara glaring at Ward...

dialogues.speaker: ARKASHIAN
dialogues.text: Jakoby’s on record saying this. Signed, sealed, witnessed.

dialogues.speaker: YAMAHARA
dialogues.text: Ladder’s thirteen feet off the ground. Thirteen. We measured it. No Orc has a six foot vertical.  21.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: Suspect was light on his feet, sir.

dialogues.speaker: ARKASHIAN
dialogues.text: Your boy kicked loose the green fuck who blasted you. Do the math. Ward doing the math...

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN PEREZ
dialogues.text: Jakoby was a social experiment mandated by outsiders. Clan Blood isn’t compatible with law enforcement. Problem is we can’t fire him without cause.

dialogues.speaker: YAMAHARA
dialogues.text: You're going to tie the noose that hangs him. Get him to admit it. Record him on this. Yamahara proffers a small digital recorder...

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: This guy’s my brother. He’s the best street cop I’ve worked with. I can’t fuck him like that.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN PEREZ
dialogues.text: Then you're fired. I want your badge, gun and ID. Ward REACTS...

dialogues.speaker: ARKASHIAN
dialogues.text: You got a house in the hood you can’t sell. Student loans up the ass. Shacked up with a stripper and her kid. Have fun looking for work as a disgraced ex-cop. Ward stares at the recorder. At his antagonists. If looks could kill they'd all be dead...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ward driving. Tense. He's palming the recorder.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: Hey partner?

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: What’s up buddy?  22. Jakoby looks up from the logbook -- With that open, hones energy he has. Ward is pole axed. He can't betray him. Surreptitiously tosses the recorder out his window.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: Where you wanna eat, partner?

dialogues.speaker: DISPATCH, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Three-Adam-Nine. Unknown disturbance. 341 Abrams Street. Code two. Incident two eight one one five.

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: Three-Adam-Nine. Show us enroute. KMA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isolated. High walls everywhere. Barbed wire. Black iron spikes. This is Altamira Locos country. Their graffiti everywhere. Ward and Jakoby cruise slowly. Jakoby clocks LITTLE HOMIE watching them from a porch...

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: Spotter. There.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: Hiii buddy. How old do you think he is, fifteen?

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: If that. This is it on the right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pull up to the house. It’s a 2 storey death trap. Th overgrown yard filled with junk cars garbage. Scary as fu

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: They should fire their landscaper.

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: (into mic) Three-Adam-Nine. Show me Code Six at Three Four One Abrams. Jakoby staring at the house, spooked...

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: What’s up? What do you see?  23.

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: Nothin. They exit the car -- The Little Homie has drifted over to watch them...

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why’s always kids doing the dirty work out here?

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: Altamira jumps ‘em in at twelve. They don’t have Hair One but they're down for life. Crossing to the house...

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: Sucks. Even Orc clans wait till you're fifteen before you get blooded.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: Different strokes.

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: I don’t see it, man. Must be a California thing.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: (laughing) That’s so you. That’s your catchphrase.

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: I don’t have a catchphrase.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: Anything you don’t agree with, it’s always like “must be a California thing.”

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: Partner!

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: Fuck me! Holy shit! They scramble back to their car -- Wards sliding over the hood, Jakoby over the trunk. KABOOM! KABOOM! Shotgun fire shredding their black and white!  24.

dialogues.speaker: WARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (into radio) Three-Adam-Nine. Shots fired. Officer needs help. Three Forty One Abrams.

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: What the fuck, man? This is bad, this is so bad.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: Easy partner. Stay in cover. KABOOM! -- The windows above them explode, spraying them glass! Ward calculates the next move...

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: Holy fuck! Holy shit!

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: Okay. Be cool. On three we’re dumping on this asshole. Just empty your mag. I’11 do the rest. One. Two... KABOOM! -- The hood is shredded. KABOOM! -- The light bar explodes...

dialogues.speaker: WARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Three! They pop up and return fire on the darkened window... BAM-BAM-BAM-BAM-BAM-BAM-BAM-BAM! -- Jakoby sprays. Ward takes careful aimed shots -- They drop back into cover. Breathing hard.

dialogues.speaker: WARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: No holes. I’m good. You okay? Ward's fine. They trade nods. Pop up again and SEE... An arm hangs from the window. Blood drips off fingertips. They got him. Now they hear a CHILD CRYING inside the hou

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There's a kid in there. Ward doesn’t hesitate. Breaks cover, running...  25.

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wait for the cavalry. Scott? Fine. Fuck it. Jakoby runs to join him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAM! -- The front door is kicked open -- Ward and Jakoby charge in.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: Police Officers! Stay where you are, we'll find you! No reponse. Ward and Jakoby ease further in.

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: I smell blood. They ease forward. Tactical. Careful. Through a gloomy darkness of ratty furniture and exposed walls...

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Body. Legs poke from a door frame leading into the kitchen. The partners advance and REACT...

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: Wh...oh shit. What is that? What is that bro? The entire top half of the dead man has been BLASTED INTO ASH, he's a blackened, charred, skeleton from the waist u A massive scorch mark on the wall... Ward stares, blinking, trying to snap himself out of shoc Jakoby isn’t doing as well.

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: Look. Shit dude, look. Ward turns, SEES a hole blown in the wall, into the back yard. Like a bomb went off... An ORC dead in the yard, half of him turned to stone, his other half gruesomely dead, a pistol next to him. Another dead man, blown in half, is in the kitchen. The two cops stare in awe.

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wh- what the fuck happened here?  26.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: (into radio) Three-Adam-Nine. Possible Bright on scene. Nothing back from the radio...

dialogues.speaker: WARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Three-Adam-Nine. Three Four One Abrams. Possible Magic User at our location. Request additional units for a perimeter and a supervisor. His radio replies with an eerie HISS. The hair stands up the back of their necks...

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: Where’s the troops? Where is everyone. Then ... a noise. Both men startle. Then push further int the dark house...

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: Door.

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: Got it. Jakoby gently pushes the cracked door, it drifts open... INT. 341 ABRAMS - SHOOTER’S ROOM - DAY The SHOOTER is slumped against the window, breathing shal shotgun on the floor. Bloody. His eyes follow the cops...

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: Do not move. Do not move. Ward advances, kicks the gun away, eyes his wounds.

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: Is he staying or going dude?

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: Hey can you hear me? Can you hear me, man, can you..? The Shooter mutters something with his dying breath...

dialogues.speaker: SHOOTER
dialogues.text: T'rein...Oter...T' lias o'ter...  27.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: What’s he saying? That Elvish?

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: Yeah, it’s Old Elvish. Suddenly a FIGURE bursts out of hiding, scrambles out the door!

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: Shit. Grab em. Grab em. Jakoby takes off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The figure bursts out the front door at a full run with Jakoby in hot pursuit -- Jakoby dives and tackles the fig knocking it to the ground... WE SEE it’s a young ELF GIRL, screaming, frantic. Fightin like a banshee. Clutching something to her chest -- She snaps at Jakoby...

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: Fuck, she’s trying to bite me! Get her hands she’s got something! Ward rushes out to help restrain the kid. She’s clearly trying to keep something away from them.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: What’s she got? What’s she holding!? Ward and Jakoby pin her down -- AN ARC OF PURPLE ELECTRIC

dialogues.speaker: BLASTS UP AND STRIKES THE POWER LINES
dialogues.text: Jakoby and Ward jump back, drawing their guns. The little girl cowers, drops what she’s holding...

dialogues.speaker: WARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Shit! ... Shit! Both cops stare in shock -- At the reedy white piece of w with a black handle and gold detailing...

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: Is that...that’s not...is that a... Yes...it's a WAND!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA FINDS the LITTLE HOMIE. Now across the street, he everything. He turns and runs up the block at full speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pollard, the dick cop from earlier, Hicks and Ward all st at the wand on the kitchen table. Sergeant Ching enters..

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT CHING
dialogues.text: There’s a blood trail leaving the property. Smells weird like gasoline.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: Gasoline? Jesus Christ, what bleeds gasoline, what's that mean?

dialogues.speaker: POLLARD
dialogues.text: The blood trail belongs to our bright. Whatever went down, he gets shot and bailed out back without his wand.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: Why aren't we evacuating the neighborhood? Remember how all those people died when the kids in Philly found a wand?

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT CHING
dialogues.text: That was before Twitter. We don’t want to start a panic. You said the elf kid used the wand?

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: The kid’s not a bright. The wand just went off or something.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT CHING
dialogues.text: What’s the kid saying?

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: The kid isn’t saying shit, she’s freaked out. Plus she doesn’t speak English, only Elvish.

dialogues.speaker: HICKS
dialogues.text: Ever seen a wand in person?

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: What? Sure ... yeah. That broken one in the Smithsonian.  29.

dialogues.speaker: POLLARD
dialogues.text: So what are we gonna do about this?

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: Secure the scene until the feds show up. This is way above our paygrades.

dialogues.speaker: HICKS
dialogues.text: I didn’t call the feds. Pollard, you call the feds?

dialogues.speaker: POLLARD
dialogues.text: Nope. Pollard, Sgt. Ching and Hicks exchange looks. Ward beginn to clock something’s wrong.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: What are we talking about here, guys. C’mon. Sarge? Sgt. Ching just stares with her cold black eyes. Then...

dialogues.speaker: POLLARD
dialogues.text: Wands royally fuck up radio reception. Dispatch never heard you. We did ‘cause we were close by. But the Department knows fuck all about the wand. If they did the whole world would be here. The wand doesn’t exist. The wand was never here. (finally...) We're taking the wand.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you even saying? You don’t know how to use a wand.

dialogues.speaker: POLLARD
dialogues.text: Don’t worry. I know people who know people.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: Come the fuck on, this isn’t happening, this is a joke.

dialogues.speaker: POLLARD
dialogues.text: That’s magic. On the table. That’s whatever you want. Want a million bucks? Ten million? (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: POLLARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You got it. Wanna be taller? Shorter? You want a bigger dick? You want fame? Power? Eternal health? That wand is anything you want. Follow your heart, Ward. A beat as Ward looks in his heart...

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: You're not stealing a wand.

dialogues.speaker: HICKS
dialogues.text: No one’s coming Ward.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT CHING
dialogues.text: Hicks back off. Scott, you need this just as much we do. Maybe more. People depend on you. People care about you. You want to be there for them, right? Fuck she's scary.

dialogues.speaker: HICKS
dialogues.text: ...-what about Jakoby..? Boom. There it is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two more cop cars outside. The little elf girl sits on Pollard’s hood, her purple eyes stare through long white blond hair hanging down over pale skin. Wrapped in a blanket, Jakoby comforts her in halting, imperfect Elvish

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: (subtitled) I will keep you safe. On my honor. Can you tell me your name? The little girl speaks quietly, through tears.

dialogues.speaker: TIKKA
dialogues.text: (subtitled) Tikka. My name is Tikka. We have to leave before they come back.

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: (subtitled) Before who comes back? Tikka's eyes say it all -- Someone utterly terrifying...  31.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ward is sweating now. Pacing. The three corrupt cops are anxious, impatient...

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: This isn’t happening, this isn’t fucking happening, this is a dream, man. This is a bad dream.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT CHING
dialogues.text: Pollard, he’s spinning.

dialogues.speaker: POLLARD
dialogues.text: He’s fine. Let him catch up to it.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: I’m not catchin’ up to shit. You don’t know magic! People will die! Ward shoves Pollard. Sgt. Ching gets in between them...

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT CHING
dialogues.text: Whoa. Easy. Bring it down.

dialogues.speaker: POLLARD
dialogues.text: Fuck this. Ward, lemme reframe this. Want your little girl to not have a father AND Jakoby dies? Or just Jakoby dies? Because you’re in fuckin fantasy land if you think you're walking outta here with life as you know it intact.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: You threatening me motherfucker?

dialogues.speaker: HICKS
dialogues.text: I think he just caught up to it.

dialogues.speaker: POLLARD
dialogues.text: Who means more to you? Your little girl or your pet monster? We're leaving with the wand. You wanna go home tonight? The orc dies either way. End of story. There’s a brutal silence. We hear the flies buzzing. The whine of the old light bulbs. Hicks is smooth as Satan...

dialogues.speaker: HICKS
dialogues.text: Use your gun. The kid got your gun away from you. And shot Jakoby with it. Right out front there.  32.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: How’s a little elf girl gonna disarm me?

dialogues.speaker: HICKS
dialogues.text: The kid was the bright. The kid got away. The kid disappeared.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: No ... come on...

dialogues.speaker: POLLARD
dialogues.text: We got people coming to help. People who know how to fix things. This will work out good for you. Pollard puts a brotherly arm around Ward... POLLARD (CONT’D) You're not making the decision, okay? The situation is making the decision for you. It’s not your fault. It’s just how things worked out.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. CHING
dialogues.text: Enough bullshit. You or him.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: Fuck! Shit! Ward takes a deep breath. We see him slowly realize there no way out...

dialogues.speaker: HICKS
dialogues.text: Perfect storm, bro. It’s a perfect storm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ward bursts out door, walking with purpose towards Jakoby

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: Hey man, where the fuck is everyone? We don’t have a perimeter. I think that pee-wee gangster saw the wand. And the Elf kid’s hell’a spooked. Saying someone’s coming back and shit. Jakoby notices Ward can’t face him...

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What’s wrong?

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: You let that kid go because he was clan blood. Admit it.

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you doing right now? What is this?

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: Tell me now! Ward shoves Jakoby, who snarls.

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: Don’t put your hands on me. ON THE HOUSE -- Sgt. Ching, Hicks, Pollard drift outside. Watching from a distance. Hicks holds the wand...

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: You fucked me! You fucked us both! You stupid piece of green shit! Ward shoves him again. Jakoby growls at him, menacing lik Doberman, frightening and animalistic. Ward gets in his face, pressing foreheads...

dialogues.speaker: WARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You fucked my fucking life for some thugged out punk ass Orc fuck.

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: Fuck you. Fuck off. Jakoby snarls. Now clearly dangerous. He doesn’t notice Ward flip the release on his holster...

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: You fucked yourself more. Shit comes back, motherfucker. Ready you fucking pigface piece of shit? Here it comes...

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: (snapping) Okay! I let him go! Is that what you fucking wanted to hear?  34.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: I knew it, I fucking KNEW it you lying sack of shit. Blood’s thicker than water, right?

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: I don’t give a shit about clan- blood! I’m not blooded! My father’s not blooded. His father’s not blooded. We’re not all caught up in that ignorant antiquated shit. My whole life I’ve caught shit from Orcs for it. Look dumbass. I have my teeth filed! (then, deflated) It’s not blood. It was the wrong kid.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: (faltering) Wha...What? EXT. SOUTH LA - SWAP MEET - JAKOBY’S FLASHBACK - DAY BLACK HOODIE runs through the stalls. Jakoby chases him. People wiping past as he runs. Jakoby exits the back. Realizes he lost the suspect -- Then SEES him in the alle

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: He ran through the swap meet. Into the crowd. Then I saw him again. EXT. SOUTH LA - DEAD END ALLEY - JAKOBY’S FLASHBACK — DAY Jakoby running. Stops pulls his gun. Black Hoodie stops. His back to us. Cornered...

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I had the motherfucker dead to rights. But it wasn’t him. Black Hoodie turns. This is a younger Orc. SIRENS approac

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The troops were coming. Responding to an assault on a peace officer. And here's a kid matching the description. He’s fucked. A bunch of jacked up humans with guns. And an Orc kid? We know how it ends. So I did the right thing.  35. CLOSE ON BLACK HOODIE’S HAND as it grasps the fire escape ladder. WIDER TO REVEAL Jakoby helping him up... A beat later two black and whites scream into the alley. Pollard, Hicks, Brown and Ching pop out with guns...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ward reeling...

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: How do you know it was the wrong guy? You see his face?

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: No. Smell. Evolution never took our sense of smell away. He smelled different. What jury would believe that?

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: So why the fuck was he running?

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: History. Cops and Orcs? I’d run too. I’m sorry the Orc who shot you’s in the wind. I lost him in the swap meet. I didn’t help him escape. I helped some kid climb a ladder to avoid a lifetime of hell. The worst part’s been lying to you. Jakoby shakes his head, trying to calm himself down.

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And you know what, fuck you for making me tell you. Ward staring at Jakoby. A weirdly dead look of calm passe over Ward's face. The situation is making the decision...

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: (quietly) I need you to stay calm, okay?

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: What? Pollard steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: POLLARD
dialogues.text: Time's up, Ward. Do it.  36.

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: Do what--? This happens so fast you can't catch your breath -- Ward draws his gun, spins: BAM-BAM-BAM-BAM-BAM-BAM! Fires textbook LAPD ‘accelerated pairs’ into center mass -- Tikka recoils screaming -- Pollard, Hicks and Ching falling! HOLY SHIT!

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wha...what the fuck? Jakoby blinks, looks at Ward thinking -- “I can’t believe did that you idiot.” Jakoby quickdraws. Aims at Ward...

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Drop it. Drop it now. TI will kill you. JI will fucking kill you. Ward tosses his gun, slowly drops to his knees...

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What the fuck? What the fuck?

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: Listen to me, Nick, I need you to-

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: Shut up and show me your hands! Ward does, Jakoby shoves him down, knee in his back. Cuff him. All business...

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: Nick?

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: Shut up!

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: Stop telling me to shut up, just fucking listen to me!

dialogues.speaker: SHUT UP
dialogues.text: Jakoby hauls Ward to his feet, stuffs him in the cruiser. SLAMS the door.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: Jakoby! I can explain! Jakoby grabs Tikka. Puts her in the passenger seat...  37.

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: (subtitled) Stay here, don’t move.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: Nick! Hear me out! Jakoby crosses to the bodies -- Tikka turns to Ward. And smiles -- Grateful. It means the World to Ward... ON JAKOBY -- SEES Ching and Hicks are motionless. Pollard crawling towards the house, leaving a wide swath of blood Jakoby turns him over -- Pollard looks at Jakoby in terro Tries to pulls his gun, but his hand slick with blood.

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: Hey Pollard, shit man, I’m getting you medical. Gimme your hand. Keep pressure on this, don’t let go. I got you, brother. Jakoby helps him staunch the wound. Next Jakoby checks Ch and Hicks. Both are dead.

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (into radio) Three-Adam-Nine. Officer down. Conscious and breathing. Two more officer's down. Not conscious not breathing. One in custody. Send me additional units. Get me an RA and a supervisor. No reply from dispatch -- Just eerie distortion... Now Jakoby notices the wand -- He grabs it. Returns to th car. Tosses it on the dash...

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: Nick! Heads up! We got looky- loos! Jakoby turns and REACTS -- Seven yoked and tatted VETERAN from Altamira approach in a phalanx. Backlit by the setti sun. The menace palpable... Jakoby stares a beat -- “I don’t need this shit." Then gr the shotgun and racks it -- KERCHACK!

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: Sir. Stay back. POISON, the shotcaller, smiles, shows his hands. Ever so friendly. Ever so cunning. Easing forward...  38.

dialogues.speaker: POISON
dialogues.text: You need some help officer?

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: Sir. This is an active crime scene. Cross the street.

dialogues.speaker: POISON
dialogues.text: So why are all the cops blasting on each other?

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: Get the fuck back.

dialogues.speaker: POISON
dialogues.text: And sabes que, homie? Word on the street’s there’s a wand in the hood. Jakoby REACTS. The Veteranos slowly encircling him...

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: Nick, unless you’re down to smoke these dude and twenty more we have to un-ass this place right now.

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: (whispering) Shut up, just shut up.

dialogues.speaker: POISON
dialogues.text: When the little homie told me, I’m like ‘hell no’. A wand? In this motherfucker? Naw. Then I hear all these cops are blasting each other. Now that’s worthy of exploration. Jakoby, noting how close they are, gets behind the driver door...

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: (subtitled) Tikka, we’re gonna be fine, stay calm. Jakoby is now surrounded. SEES hands in pockets, hidden behind backs. These fuckers are armed. Now Poison SEES th wand on the dash...

dialogues.speaker: POISON
dialogues.text: That’s it, huh? That shit don’t belong to the Government. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: POISON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It belongs to the Community. To the people. We'll take it now. Jakoby aims the shotgun at Poison...

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: Anyone makes a move, I’m shooting you in the face. You. Not them. Poison just smiles. Jakoby slowly sits in the driver's se Still aiming at Poison. Jakoby keys his radio:

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (into mic) Three-Adam-Nine. I’m Code Six George at Three Four One Abrams. Get me back-up and an airship. Just more creepy HISSING in response...

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: It’s the wand. Radios don’t work.

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: Shut up, man. I got this.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: We have to go! Jakoby!

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: I’m not leaving Pollard!

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: Pollard wanted me to kill you! He’s not the victim here! WHAM! -- The windshield is hit with a CROWBAR! Veteranos jump on the hood and trunk. Attacking from all sides...

dialogues.speaker: WARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They're gonna kill us! Go! Go! Jakoby starts the car and stomps the gas. Throws it in reverse. Sending Veteranos tumbling. He does an E-brake turn. Then guns it up the street, siren blaring...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jakoby barrels up the street. Tikka screaming in fear. Jakoby breathing hard. It feels so good to get away...  40.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: Slow down. Dude. Slow the fuck down ! The wand starts to GLOW...

dialogues.speaker: WARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Nick! Snap out of it! Slow d... The wand floats into the air, vibrating with energy... KA-WHAM! -- The car plows into ... nothing. The front end crushes in like it just hit an invisible brick wall! Then silence. The wand stops glowing. The smashed vehicle steams, bleeding oil and water in the middle of the stree Night has begun to fall over South LA...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kandomere, the Elf Fed we met earlier, flips through boxe arrest forms. His photographic memory drinking in the inf fast as he turns the page. Montehugh, his human partner, enters in a rush...

dialogues.speaker: MONTEHUGH
dialogues.text: Something’s going down. Kandomere looks up and cocks an eyebrow: “Go on.” MONTEHUGH (CONT’D) Tech services flagged some weird ass cellphone intercepts. Bunch’a cops talking about a bright-

dialogues.speaker: KANDOMERE
dialogues.text: I've heard nothing on the scanner.

dialogues.speaker: MONTEHUGH
dialogues.text: -and talking about a wand.

dialogues.speaker: KANDOMERE
dialogues.text: Where? He has Kandomere’s full attention...

dialogues.speaker: MONTEHUGH
dialogues.text: Guess. They can't get out of there fast enough...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sky is hesitant to release the day, its final soft bl glow recedes from the darkness. It’s unnaturally quiet on this evil isolated little street... HIDDEN ON THE PORCH -- Pollard, in agony, trying to dial iPhone. It’s maddening to work a touch screen through so much blood. He hears an SUV pull up. FOOTSTEPS approach. He sets down his cell. Grabs his gun... GIBSON crosses to the house. Stops to pick up WARD’S GUN. She could be 20 or 40. Her age and gender are a mystery. But she’s clearly an apex predator. Everything she does i weighted with thought, meaning and intent, down to the smallest movement. She steps over the bodies of Sergeant Ching and Hicks. Behind her are SLASHER and COWBOY, with carbines and body armor. They have that Special Forces vibe, a couple hundr confirmed kills between them. Gibson stepping, Pollard slumps with relief...

dialogues.speaker: POLLARD
dialogues.text: Gibson? Thank fuck. She turns to her muscle...

dialogues.speaker: GIBSON
dialogues.text: Get him inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pollard sits at the kitchen table. Slasher and Cowboy reg the hole blown in the wall. Pollard groans in pain. Gibso studies him silently for a time. Then sits across from hi

dialogues.speaker: GIBSON
dialogues.text: You going to be all right?

dialogues.speaker: POLLARD
dialogues.text: What? Fuck no, I’m... help me.

dialogues.speaker: GIBSON
dialogues.text: Of course. Help is coming. (beat) Where’s the wand?

dialogues.speaker: POLLARD
dialogues.text: They took it ... they took it ... fuckers shot me!  42.

dialogues.speaker: GIBSON
dialogues.text: Describe it.

dialogues.speaker: POLLARD
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: GIBSON
dialogues.text: The wand. Describe it.

dialogues.speaker: POLLARD
dialogues.text: S'white ... gold ... black handle.

dialogues.speaker: GIBSON
dialogues.text: “They” who took it are... (reading off her phone) Scott Ward and Jakoby the Orc? Is that correct?

dialogues.speaker: POLLARD
dialogues.text: That’s...that’s right...Local gangsters chased them off.

dialogues.speaker: GIBSON
dialogues.text: Humans?

dialogues.speaker: POLLARD
dialogues.text: Yeah. Hispanic gang.

dialogues.speaker: GIBSON
dialogues.text: Do they know about the wand? Pollard just groans. Gibson turns to Slasher and Cowboy.

dialogues.speaker: GIBSON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Priority one is to secure that wand. It might be with the gang. It might be with the cops. Gibson thinking as Pollard bleeds on the floor. Drip. Dri Drip...

dialogues.speaker: GIBSON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are there GPS units in your patrol vehicles?

dialogues.speaker: POLLARD
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: GIBSON
dialogues.text: We'll find him that way. (to Cowboy and Slasher) Get on the bodies.  43. Cowboy and Slasher quickly exit. She shows Ward’s Glock t Pollard...

dialogues.speaker: GIBSON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Is this the weapon Ward used?

dialogues.speaker: POLLARD
dialogues.text: Yeah. BAM! -- Gibson shoots Pollard in the head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slasher rolls Ching’s body in a carpet. Another rolled up carpet presumably contains Hicks. Cowboy uses a metal detector to locate shell casings from Ward's gun... Gibson exits. Looking around. Scanning for prey. Feels someone watching her. Spins to SEE SOMEONE duck behind th curtains of the little house across the street...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gibson KNOCKS -- Holds an LAPD badge to the window.

dialogues.speaker: GIBSON
dialogues.text: Police! LAPD! The door opens. Still chained. An OLD MAN peers at her... GIBSON (SPANISH) (CONT’D) I need to ask you some questions. You can talk to me here, or talk to me downtown. The door closes. The chain is removed. It opens again. INT. OLD MAN’S HOUSE - 5 MINUTES LATER - NIGHT The OLD MAN and OLD WOMAN clearly want no part of this. B are cooperating. Gibson takes notes...

dialogues.speaker: GIBSON, (SPANISH)
dialogues.text: The police were shooting at each other?

dialogues.speaker: OLD MAN, (SPANISH)
dialogues.text: We've lived here for thirty years, and never seen that.

dialogues.speaker: GIBSON, (SPANISH)
dialogues.text: Who shot the other police? The Orc?

dialogues.speaker: OLD MAN, (SPANISH)
dialogues.text: No the white man. The Orc took him away in handcuffs.

dialogues.speaker: GIBSON, (SPANISH)
dialogues.text: The Orc handcuffed him?

dialogues.speaker: OLD WOMAN, (SPANISH)
dialogues.text: Yes. The Orc was mad at the other one for all the killing. (then) They have a wand.

dialogues.speaker: GIBSON, (SPANISH)
dialogues.text: Do they? Who have you told?

dialogues.speaker: OLD MAN, (SPANISH)
dialogues.text: Nobody.

dialogues.speaker: GIBSON
dialogues.text: Good. BLAM-BLAM! BLAM-BLAM! Gibson kills them. This person is not a police officer. There’s blood in the air -- And the animals have come out to hunt...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wrecked cop car still smoking. No movement inside -- cars slowly approach. Stop at a distance. Doors open. Poison and six Veteranos get out. SHADOW starts toward th cop car. Poison grabs his collar, stopping him.

dialogues.speaker: POISON
dialogues.text: Kick back, fool. Poison pulls a Mac 10 from his back -- BRDDDDDDDDDT! Punc a couple dozen holes in the wreck. Dogs bark. Lights burn in houses. No one dares come out.

dialogues.speaker: POISON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Alright, let’s do this. They advance on the wreck -- Find it empty. Poison reache in. His fingers come out wet -- Blood. He shows his homie

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW
dialogues.text: Poison, let’s jam outta here before the rollers show up.  45.

dialogues.speaker: POISON
dialogues.text: Tranquilo, ese. No one’s coming for them or they’d be here. These fools got no ride, no back-up and they're leaking blood.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW
dialogues.text: So what’s up then?

dialogues.speaker: POISON
dialogues.text: I want every homie in the Hood going door to door like Avon. These dudes are close. The Veteranos start texting the world on their cells. Poi squats in the street. Smells the night air. Looks around with a hunter’s eye...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEHIND A DUMPSTER -- Jakoby holds Tikka, one hand over he mouth, the other grips the shotgun. Ward next to them. A bloody cut on his forehead from the crash. The wand is tucked into Jakoby’s belt. Jakoby leans out. SEES Poison and his homies spreading out. Searching.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: Don’t do anything.

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: Shut up, man.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: I’m serious. Be cool.

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: I’m not doing shit. They’re gonna fucking hear you. Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: Uncuff me bro. Uncuff me.

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: Hell no. Shut up dude. His teddy-bear personality isn’t built for this intensity

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What the fuck did the car hit?

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: It’s the wand, man, it went nuts and we crashed. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: WARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Bet it’s a binding spell, stops it from getting too far from its owner. Nick you have to uncuff me, there’s blood in my eyes.

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: Get up. Move. Tikka, stay behind me. Jakoby roughly pulls Ward to his feet, frog marches him a from the cholos...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you ain’t from here, stay out. Sad little houses. Peeling paint. Iron fences. Pitbulls.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: We got to get off the street.

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: (whispering) Stop fucking talking! Two Cholos appear up the street--

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: shit... --start running towards towards them! Jakoby decides to stand his ground. Aims the shotgun. Ward pulls away and disappears up a driveway. Tikka looks at Jakoby like he’s crazy and votes with her feet, runs after Ward...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ward kicks off a padlock then leans on the garage door, u his weight to roll it up. Tikka dives under it. Then Ward drops and rolls inside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ward closes it with his boot. Then it rolls back up. Revealing Jakoby -- He had second thoughts. Jakoby closes the door behind him. Tikka cowers in the corner. Ward loo at Jakoby, yell whispers:

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: You uncuff me right fuckin’ now Nick. I swear to God I’m gonna lose my shit.  47. Jakoby paces, nervous, shaking his head. They go back and forth in hushed tones...

dialogues.speaker: WARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If you ever trusted me, I need you to trust me right now.

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: You shot three cops. You whacked out our Sergeant. You're a fucking psycho. Why dude? Why’d you snap?

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: I'll explain. It’s me, partner. It’s still me. I can explain but you gotta unhook me.

dialogues.speaker: TIKKA
dialogues.text: Shhbbh. Both men go quiet, listen -- HEAR approaching VOICES. Jak looks at Ward. Ward looks at Jakoby. THEN... Jakoby uncuffs him. Pulls his Glock. Hands it to Ward. They aim their gun at the door.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: Fuck, man, the lock.

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: Lock’s on the ground out there. The VOICES are close. Very close. They wait. Guns ready. Tikka says an Elvish prayer to herself. The VOICES pass. And fade. Jakoby lets out a shuddery exhale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten Homeboys the block, one with a pair of pitbulls, ente yards and check cars like a Sheriff's posse...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tikka draws odd runes in the dust on an old mirror. Jakob cleans Ward's forehead wound. Ward has been explaining.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: They just turned, man. They were like wolves, like fuckin animals. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: WARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I could kill them. Or I could kill you. And I‘d never hurt you. Jakoby lowers his head, sad, weary...

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: ‘Real Orcs’ don’t give me any respect, I ain’t blooded so they treat me like I’m nothing. Since I was a little kid. And humans hate me cause I’m green.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: That’s not true.

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: Stop. We know who likes us and who doesn’t. We picked the wrong side a long time ago and have been paying for it since. (tearing up) Shit dude, you’re the only motherfucker who didn’t look down on me. And then you come tearing outta that house with a look in your eye like you hated me.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: ..-I don't hate you...

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: I’m sorry I lied to you. They are still brothers. It feels good.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: Nick, what the fuck are we gonna do? What’s our gameplan here?

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: We’re not calling anyone in the department. That’s for sure. Let’s take someone’s car. And get out of this neighborhood.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: The wand will just stop us again.

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: Then we leave the wand.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: No way. Even without a bright, dude, you took History. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: WARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: In the wrong hands it’s bodies in the streets. It’s all of LA on fire.

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: The Feds are the obvious play here.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: I’m not in a good spot, bro. With three dead cops on my gun.

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: I...shit. Bro you need to say something positive right now.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: Can't lie, you look pretty bad ass with the shotgun. Jakoby laughs -- Then bingo...

dialogues.speaker: WARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I got it. Rodriguez. Dude’s solid as fuck. We call Rodriguez, he’s still working. He can-- --Tikka speaks up, startling them both...

dialogues.speaker: TIKKA
dialogues.text: (subtitled) She's coming for her wand. We must go.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: What'd she say?

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: (subtitled, to Tikka) Who will come looking? She points at the wand in Jakoby’s belt and whispers...

dialogues.speaker: TIKKA
dialogues.text: (subtitled) The witch. Jakoby REACTS...

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: Nick? Translate please. There’s a NOISE OUTSIDE -- They freeze...  50.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pitbulls strain against their chains as ten armed VETERANOS stare at the garage door. Poison picks up the lock. Turns to the others with a finger over his lips.

dialogues.speaker: POISON
dialogues.text: .--Shhhh... Nods for a Veterano to open the door. Guns are raised...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jakoby and Ward enter the connected house from the back o the garage with Tikka in tow and silently clear the dark house. They startle a Latina SINGLE MOM in her pajamas...

dialogues.speaker: SINGLE MOM
dialogues.text: Por favor, no me hagan dano.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: Calmate. No le vamos a hacer nada. In a carseat on the table, her Baby starts CRYING. Ward a Jakoby exchange a look. Tikka alert with fear.

dialogues.speaker: WARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Que callas al bebe por favor. The gangsters outside circle like jackals -- Their menaci SHADOWS sweeping across the curtains. They are being surrounded -- Now the Baby starts SCREAMING.

dialogues.speaker: WARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Muevate. The woman grabs her baby from the carseat. The Baby SCREA EVEN LOUDER...

dialogues.speaker: WARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Que callas al bebe. Shut your fucking baby up right now, shut it up right now.

dialogues.speaker: SINGLE MOM
dialogues.text: Lo siento. Perdoname.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: Don’t fucking apologize, lady. Shut your fucking kid up right now. She frantically shushes the baby. Impossibly the baby HOW louder and LOUDER. The tension unbearable.  51. Jakoby looks to Ward, frantic. Acting on pure instinct, W pushes the woman to the ground...

dialogues.speaker: WARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Stay low, don’t m-- BRDDDDDDT! BAM-BAM-BAM-BAM-BAM! The gangsters open fire o the house. Windows explode. Bullets rip through the walls

dialogues.speaker: WARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We're not stayin here and getting them killed. Move! Move! With bullets SMASHING all around them, Ward and Jakoby ma break for the back door with Tikka in tow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jakoby nearly takes the back door off its hinges. A VETER is right there! He opens fire -- POP-POP-POP! KABOOM! -- Jakoby fires the shotgun. Shredding the fucker Ward covers Tikka’s eyes so she doesn’t see the body. Jak jumps a fence. Ward hands him Tikka and follows...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Veteranos YELLING. WHISTLING. Ward and Jakoby running. Jakoby holding Tikka. Two Veteranos vault the fence into alley and open fire -- POP-POP-POP-POP! Ward stops. Draws and aims. Bullets ZIP past his head. Ward focuses on breathing. Sight picture. Trigger squeeze BAM-BAM! -- The two Veteranos drop with headshots. Say wh you want about Ward but the dude’s a natural born gunfigh He runs to catch up to Jakoby... EXT. SOUTH LA —- ANOTHER STREET - NIGHT (SAME TIME) Jakoby and Ward running. Tikka in Jakoby’s arms. We hear the WHISTLES and SHOUTS of the angry storm of Gangsters intercepting them... UP THE STREET -- Is a raucous HOUSE PARTY. Bass THUMPS. Vapes glow. 40’s are drained. Girls in underwear are hose down. Fun and games to escape the heat.

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: There, go go!  52. They cut towards the party. Tikka SCREAMS in warning... BEHIND THEM -- Ten Altamira Soldiers explode out of the a behind them. Sprinting like cheetahs on the Serengeti. Cheetahs with guns -- POP-POP-POP-POP! Ward stops and turns to return fire -- THWAP! -- HE'S IMMEDIATELY SPUN BY A BULLET HITTING HIS LEFT ARM.

dialogues.speaker: WARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Arghhhh. Fuck! Fuck! He drops to a knee. Aims one handed -- BLAM-BLAM-BLAM! Drops another asshole. Scattering the Gangsters, buying precious seconds. Ward keeps running...

dialogues.speaker: JAKOBY
dialogues.text: Scott!?

dialogues.speaker: WARD
dialogues.text: Keep going!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PARTYGOERS react to the gunfire. Squatting down as one do in the Hood. They’re mostly ORCS, many in Fogteeth Gang colors -- Black and orange. They aren't happy to see the cops... WHACK! -- An Altamira bullet hits the porch. Now the Orcs pull guns and RETURN FIRE!

dialogues.speaker: ORC VOICES
dialogues.text: ... Fogteeth motherfuckers! ... .+. This is Fogteeth’s Hood! ... -+. Fogteeth for life! ... Ward and Jakoby run straight past them into:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claustrophobic, dark and way too loud. Crowded with danci bodies. Mostly Orcs. A few Humans. With no clue about the drama outside. Jakoby and Ward plowing through them. Ward blood-slick arm smears a HOTTIE. She starts SCREAMING. Getting them noticed... Ores close around Ward. Shoving him roughly. Jakoby sees one draw a knife! Jakoby covers Tikka’s eyes and PEPPER SPRAYS THE ENTIRE ROOM! The fucking Red Sea parts and Jak grabs Ward by his belt...  53.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jakoby crashes out the back door dragging a blinded and bloodied Ward and a screaming Tikka. Livid pepper sprayed Orcs following him out... KABOOM! -- Jakoby fires the shotgun in the air and growls something in ORKISH. Stalling their pursuers. He scoops u Tikka and hauls Ward through the back gate into another alley. They disappear into the night...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cowboy and Slasher regarding the wrecked black and white. Gibsons circling it in silence. She looks up, studies the houses. Measuring time and distance in her mind. She notices something on the ground. Crosses to it... Footprints -- In black iridescent blood, like gasoline.

dialogues.speaker: SLASHER
dialogues.text: What’s up, Gibson?

dialogues.speaker: GIBSON
dialogues.text: The bright. Looking for the wand.

dialogues.speaker: SLASHER
dialogues.text: This change anything?

dialogues.speaker: GIBSON
dialogues.text: Yes. We’re not the biggest shark in the water. So we have to be the smartest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kandomere KNOCKS on the back of an old plumbing van hidde the shadows. Nothing. Grabs door handle. The door falls off CLATTERING to the street... Revealing two OBLITERATED BODIES inside! The first has be blasted into what looks like red spider-webs. The other i shattered like glass. It’s clear from the equipment racks it’s a SURVEILLANCE VAN. Montehugh joins Kandomere, holdi two assault rifles...

dialogues.speaker: KANDOMERE
dialogues.text: The bright was here. Montehugh tosses Kandomere a rifle. The hair stands up on the back of his neck when he SEES his colleagues are now modern art displays...  54.

dialogues.speaker: MONTEHUGH
dialogues.text: Lemme get local PD down here to contain the area.

dialogues.speaker: KANDOMERE
dialogues.text: Take a beat on that. Until we know who’s who and what’s what. They’re a few houses up 341 Abrams -- Kandomere steps out into the street and SEES parked black and white just visi Nods for Montehugh to follow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kandomere and Montehugh approach on foot, cautious, rifle low ready position. They SEE BROWN, the fratboy cop from station. Talking on his cell. He quickly hangs up...

dialogues.speaker: KANDOMERE
dialogues.text: What do you got?

dialogues.speaker: BROWN
dialogues.text: Sir this is LAPD business, we have an active crime scene.

dialogues.speaker: KANDOMERE
dialogues.text: (flashing badge) Homeland Security Magic Task Force. It’s my crime scene now.

dialogues.speaker: BROWN
dialogues.text: Sorry, sir. Uh. Yes. Sure. But look, it’s all fucked.

dialogues.speaker: KANDOMERE
dialogues.text: Mind if we drill down a bit on what you mean by ‘fucked’?

dialogues.speaker: BROWN
dialogues.text: There was a shooting between the responding officers. I got three dead cops. Two more missing. A dead couple with gunshot wounds across the street. Four bodies inside. And someone staging and cleaning the crime scene. That’s what I meant by fucked, sir.

dialogues.speaker: KANDOMERE
dialogues.text: Where’s the bright come into this?  55.

dialogues.speaker: BROWN
dialogues.text: The four bodies from the original call are magicked the fuck up. (then) Who called you?

dialogues.speaker: KANDOMERE
dialogues.text: This is a Shield Of Light safehouse. An extremist group convinced the Dark Lord will return and initiate a second Age of Magic.

dialogues.speaker: BROWN
dialogues.text: The crazy ass conspiracy theorists? They just hand out fliers on the corner. It’s bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: KANDOMERE
dialogues.text: Right. Until someone kills four of them and the two Agents surveilling them with a magic wand. Then, I’m not so sure.

dialogues.speaker: BROWN
dialogues.text: You guys been watching this place?

dialogues.speaker: MONTEHUGH
dialogues.text: Agent Kandomere? He nods for him to join him. Out of earshot. For all of Kandomere’s Elvish wisdom and intellect, he’s not streets like Montehugh. MONTEHUGH (CONT’D) Hey. We gotta get Vance’s people down here right the fuck now and lock this place down. Local PD's got some dirty ass Rampart shit going down. There’s a wand on the streets. All bets are off. Kandomere processing. He’s right. The two Agents fading back to the street...

dialogues.speaker: KANDOMERE
dialogues.text: Pull the hard drive from the van. Right now. We need those recordings safe. Kandomere dials his cell...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dozen Federal Swat Operators towel off, overdo Axe body spray, comb their hair carefully. It’s Friday night and t to slay it in the bars after a long training day. GORDON VANCE, Alpha of these Alphas, grabs his RINGING cell...

dialogues.speaker: GORDON VANCE
dialogues.text: Vance.

dialogues.speaker: KANDOMERE
dialogues.text: Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: GORDON VANCE
dialogues.text: Up at the facility. We’re punching out for the day.

dialogues.speaker: KANDOMERE
dialogues.text: No you're not. Shit went down at the Shield of Light House we've been watching. The bright killed everyone inside and killed my men monitoring the place. The bright’s here. Here in LA.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON VANCE
dialogues.text: Aw fuck, man.

dialogues.speaker: KANDOMERE
dialogues.text: LAPD’s all twisted up in this. I’m behind enemy lines with no back-up. You're it. Get down here. At the speed of light.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON VANCE
dialogues.text: We're in fucking Lancaster, boss. It’s gonna be while. Stay safe and hang on. Vance hangs up. SIGHS. Turns to the boys... GORDON VANCE (CONT’D) Suit back up! We got a magic user on the street. Grab your gear and get on the road! Their REACTIONS say it all. A bright? Magic user? They know people are going to die tonight...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kandomere hangs up. Worry etched on his face.  57.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kandomere and Montehugh looking through the mess...

dialogues.speaker: MONTEHUGH
dialogues.text: We got the two bodies in the kitchen and the one in back the bright wanded. The guy the first responders shot. We know the Elf Girl was taken.
